block.p: Elizabeth Sophia Polenz, an architect, and Scott Rapoport, a correspondent for a television news service, were married last evening. Rabbi David A. Whiman officiated at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.

Mrs. Rapoport, 34, works at Pei Cobb Freed & Partners, the architecture firm in Manhattan. She graduated cum laude from Tufts University and received a master's degree in architecture from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. She is the daughter of Dr. Magda Polenz of Manhattan and Daryl Polenz of White Plains. Her father retired as a manager of market research for Prodigy Services, an Internet service provider in White Plains. Her mother, a physician based in Manhattan, is a surveyor for the Joint Commission on the Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations.

Elizabeth Sophia Polenz, an architect, and Scott Rapoport, a correspondent for a television news service, were married last evening. Rabbi David A. Whiman officiated at the Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.

Mrs. Rapoport, 34, works at Pei Cobb Freed & Partners, the architecture firm in Manhattan. She graduated cum laude from Tufts University and received a master's degree in architecture from Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute. She is the daughter of Dr. Magda Polenz of Manhattan and Daryl Polenz of White Plains. Her father retired as a manager of market research for Prodigy Services, an Internet service provider in White Plains. Her mother, a physician based in Manhattan, is a surveyor for the Joint Commission on the Accreditation of Healthcare Organizations.

Mr. Rapoport, 42, reports on news and entertainment for CBS News Path, a service in New York. He graduated from Boston University. He is a son of Violet and Robert J. Rapoport of Oyster Bay Cove, N.Y. His father is a trial lawyer in Oyster Bay Cove.
